dt: {bc}an atom or group of atoms that carries a positive or negative electric charge as a result of having lost or gained one or more electrons
{bc}a charged subatomic particle (such as a free electron)

et: Greek, neuter of {it}iōn{/it}, present participle of {it}ienai{/it} to go {ma}{mat|issue:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: an atom or group of atoms that carries a positive or negative electric charge as a result of having lost or gained one or more electrons
a charged subatomic particle (such as a free electron)
result of an act or process

dt: {bc}the cation H{sup}+{/sup} of acids consisting of a hydrogen atom whose electron has been transferred to the anion of the acid

shortdef: the cation H+ of acids consisting of a hydrogen atom whose electron has been transferred to the anion of the acid
